intro: Anacheilium simum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to Tanzania and Kenya. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white, typically blooming from spring to autumn. Its leaves are velvety and heart-shaped, often with a striking silver or white pattern. Anacheilium simum thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
